newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY FARMERS TO RENEW ROADBLOCKS ON WEDNESDAY.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY FARMERS TO RENEW ROADBLOCKS ON WEDNESDAY.

text.p: Hungarian farmers said they will restart roadblocks on Wednesday if the finance minister refuses to attend talks in Kiskoros, south Hungary.
Official news agency MTI reported that the leader of the protesters, Gyula Kosa, said the government did not keep its promise to continue talks in Kiskoros if necessary.
The farmers have blocked roads throughout the country with tractors, ploughs, harvesters and other equipment for most of last week.
They were protesting at the end of an exemption from social security contributions as of January 1 and new requirements to provide documentation for tax purposes.
After a preliminary agreement last Tuesday, the government sent its written proposal to the farmers on Thursday, accepting most of their claims.
On Friday, in reply to the government's letter, Kosa invited a government delegation for "further talks" in Kiskoros.

On Monday, Finance Minister Peter Medgyessy sent a letter to Kosa, president of a farmers' association formed last Friday, inviting him to interest coordination talks on Wednesday in Budapest, but a ministry official said neither Medgyessy, nor a government delegation will go to Kiskoros.
"There is neither the possibility nor the time for separate talks with each interest group," Medgyessy said in his letter.
